comment: She taught this online class with another prof and maybe that's why it was chaos. A good amount of busy work, in a pandemic, and the syllabus and the d2l instructions rarely matched. The instructions were VERY vague and then they give specific feedback for things they never stated in the instructions. Rude replies when asked for grade corrections.

This class is an easy A, but your going to be doing homework weekly and at times more than one assignment. The assignments she gives aren't hard but they are going take some time to complete. And she gives terrible instructions and expects you to know what she wants. i took 6 classes this semester and this class alone was equal to taking 3 courses.

Dr. Borders is a great professor. At the beginning of the semester, she makes it clear her expectations of you. Lectures are more like discussions, so come to class I would skim the textbook and do the extra work she assigns (even though it is not graded) because it will help you tremendously on the final. Dr. Borders is a wonderful woman & teacher
Students had to teach a chapter to the class, would prefer if we didn't. She gives great feedback, always responsive, cheerful, and fair grader. Do the work.

I don't like the format of the class (students lead discussions, very dull and you zone out). This is a class that APPEARS easy because the material is easy to understand. HOWEVER, her test questions are tricky so READ THE BOOK and ask her lots of questions. Ten small essays due, 4 exams, group lecture/discussion, and role plays.  Awesome professor
No tests. Quizes and role plays are entire grade. Very funny and enjoyable to be around.

Borders is hilarious and has a good time with her students, making sure they actually try to care about the class! She will have many assignments and close to ten quizzes; stay on top of everything and be sure to communicate with her, as she is not always clear.

I absolutely love Dr. Borders. By this time in your academic career, she knows you can handle having freedom to learn what you want and not baby you all semester. She really gives you the opportunity to make the course what you want it to be, and always is trying to make you understand in a better way. I would take her again in a heartbeat!
She is a very nice professor but is completely disorganized. Every class seemed as if she was figuring out what the class was doing for the day right then.

Its a shame that this class is so sloppy and confusing. Borders literally makes up everything on the spot and arbitrarily creates grading rubics on a whim. When she gives quizzes, students have no idea what chapters to study - her response is study the book.

She is very confusing. I learned absolutely nothing. If you want an easy A take her but she is very confusing. I think she just walks into the class room and randomly decides what we will be learning that day. She never teaches she makes the students teach every single chapter.

Dr. Borders can be very confusing at times, but she means well. I had to learn to "embrace the confusion" many times, and do NOT let the topicals get away from you! As small as they are, they all add up! She even curved my grade at the end. If you talk to her outside of class she is less confusing.

Dr. Borders is a wonderful professor.  Attend class and complete your assignments and you will do well in her class. She is ready and willing to answer questions and provide help any way that she can.
Professional Selling. It was a pointless class but the professor was nice. It met the requirements for my minor but I would not recommend this class if you actually want to learn.

I have Borders for Professional Sales and although it is extremely easy, it is also very boring and pointless! She does not know how to teach at all and every assignment she gives you is very unorganized and unclear! The entire semester all you do is watch people role play. It is an easy A but also a huge waste of time, I haven't learned one thing!

Prof is very pleasant, helpful, and flexible. Attendance is taken. Students required to come to class prepared; having completed reading assignment. Quizzes often came straight from text materials. Projects include presentations of case studies, running a marketing department via simulation software, write marketing plan. Many chances for makeup.
